column4: root should be truly disabled by default. cause now its not all the user has to do is sudo passwd root and then su.
i disable su on my systems.
shut-up and listen you will see the point.
gnome is about the only exception
you could file a wishlist bug on the kernel asking for it to be included
debian has newer packages than ubuntu in nearly every case
more or less everything else in ubuntu comes from debian
e.g. debian had a more recent version of X than ubuntu for a few weeks, and now they are the same
people can be anonymou in their private irc channel
